title.narrative: 5.2 National and sub-national duty bearers have increased capacity to develop inclusive national and local development agendas (ie. policy, programme, budgets) and report on child rights obligations (CRC, CEDAW, UPR and the Convention on Disability)

description.narrative: UNICEF Lebanon's work on Social Policy in 2019 was characterized by the development of analysis and key partnerships to further promote inclusive development in the country, including collaborative analysis with the IMF on the equity of Lebanon's growth model, a new partnership with the Institute of Finance, support to sector policy analysis and advocacy, and definition of UNICEF Lebanon's policy priorities. UNICEF also successfully launched work to develop a National Social Protection Policy and also designed and launched a new integrated social assistance programme reaching over 3,500 children by year-end. Furthermore, 2019 saw the commencement of local governance work. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of child friendly subnational policies (plans, programs and budgets) (incl. municipalities) with plans and budgets that prioritise boys, girls and women, including marginalized groups

Number of equity analysis undertaken (RAM National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures)
